page.title: 15The Bookshop, Otford.
page.content: On Tuesday we went to the Bookshop to ask the Manageress some questions and this is what we found out. The shop was once a cottage and is over 350 years old. Each year they sell about 100 books, most in December. New books are bought from publishers or wholesalers. There are over 6000 books in stock, the most expensive costing #60. They employ three people and open shop hours each week. They have 800 children's books in stock. They sell mostly non-fiction books. They are least busy in February. About 10 people order books each week. Several times there have been shoplifters but the shop has not, so far, been broken into.
